rand-althor.name: Rand al'Thor
aliases: He Who Comes With the Dawn

1.description: The chosen one, attempting to consolidate his rule over Cairhien while planning his next moves against the remaining ancient enemy.

9.description: Ta'veren and friend to Rand, reluctantly drawn into adventures while trying to avoid Aes Sedai. In Ebou Dar helping search for the Bowl of the Winds.

relationships.Tylin Quintara: The Queen of Altara, complicated relationship

8.description: Ta'veren with the ability to speak with wolves. Searching for Masema the Prophet on Rand's orders, accompanied by Aes Sedai.

relationships.Faile Bashere: Wife, left behind for this dangerous mission
relationships.Aram: Former Tinker, now his devoted follower

22.description: The young Amyrlin Seat of the rebel Aes Sedai, working to unite the scattered Sisters and plan their assault on the White Tower.
22.role: Amyrlin Seat of the Rebel Aes Sedai

relationships.Siuan Sanche: Former Amyrlin, now her advisor and teacher
relationships.Romanda Cassin: Powerful Yellow Sitter, often opposes her

9.description: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah with exceptional Healing abilities. In Ebou Dar searching for the Bowl of the Winds with Elayne and Mat.
9.role: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah

relationships.Mat Cauthon: Reluctant ally from the Two Rivers

9.description: Daughter-Heir of Andor and Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. Searching for the Bowl of the Winds in Ebou Dar while managing complex political situations.

28.description: An Aiel Wise One apprentice accompanying the Aes Sedai mission in Ebou Dar and learning to navigate wetlander ways.

35.description: Provides Aiel perspective and abilities while adapting to the complex situation in Ebou Dar.

1.description: Young woman with the ability to see images around people that foretell their futures. Stays close to Rand as his lover and advisor.

18.description: Legendary Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah, oldest living Sister. Known for her strength and her unusual ornaments. Seeks to find and aid the chosen one.
18.role: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah

relationships.Rand al'Thor: Seeks to guide and teach him

32.description: One of the ancient enemy, ruling Illian as Lord Brend. Commands significant forces and schemes against Rand al'Thor and the other ancient enemy.

relationships.Rand al'Thor: Sworn enemy, target of his hatred

1.description: One of the ancient enemy, known for her beauty and her collection of pets. Schemes and manipulates from her palace, playing complex games.

30.description: One of the ancient enemy, known as the Spider for her preference for hidden schemes and traps. Currently bound and controlled.

relationships.Moridin: Fellow ancient enemy who controls her

1.description: One of the most powerful ancient enemy, recently returned. Commands other ancient enemy and orchestrates complex schemes against the Light.

relationships.Cyndane: Fellow ancient enemy under his command

12.description: Queen of Altara, rules from the Tarasin Palace in Ebou Dar. Known for her strong will and direct manner. Takes an interest in Mat Cauthon.

relationships.Mat Cauthon: Takes a particular interest in him

31.description: A young nobleman in Altara, heir to Queen Tylin and learning the complexities of royal duties.

14.description: Eldest of the Kin, a secret organization of women who failed to become Aes Sedai but can still channel. Maintains the Kin's strict hierarchy and secrecy.

15.description: One of the Kin, a skilled Healer who works as a midwife in Ebou Dar. Strong in the One Power but bound by the Kin's rules about secrecy.
One of the Kin, a woman who failed to become Aes Sedai but retained her ability to channel. Follows the Kin's strict rules about hiding their abilities.
One of the Kin living in Ebou Dar, bound by their rules of secrecy. Has lived much longer than her apparent age due to channeling.

9.description: Legendary archer ripped from Tel'aran'rhiod into the real world. Now serves as Elayne's Warder and closest companion, adapting to life in the flesh.
Court-bard and gleeman with a mysterious past. Accompanies the group in Ebou Dar, providing valuable knowledge and skills while hiding his own agenda.
Thief-catcher from Tear, skilled at finding people and things. Accompanies the group in Ebou Dar, using his professional skills to aid their search.

relationships.Amathera: Former Panarch of Tarabon, complicated relationship

9.description: Young boy under Mat's care, orphaned and street-smart. Follows Mat around Ebou Dar, getting into mischief and learning city ways.

relationships.Tylin Quintara: The Queen who tolerates his presence

22.description: Warder to Nynaeve and last crowned King of Malkier. A master warrior bound by duty and honor, now married to Nynaeve al'Meara.

2.description: Marshal-General of Saldaea and one of the Great Captains. Leads the Saldaean cavalry in service to Rand, bringing military expertise and loyalty.

3.description: Former False Dragon, now leader of the Black Tower and trainer of Asha'man. Serves Rand but maintains his own agenda and authority over male channelers.

relationships.Rand al'Thor: Serves as leader of his Asha'man

4.description: Former False Dragon, now an Asha'man serving under Rand. Maintains his dignity and some independence despite his defeat and current position.

relationships.Mazrim Taim: Rival and fellow former False Dragon

22.description: Former Amyrlin Seat, now advisor to Egwene. Stilled and Healed, much reduced in strength but retaining her political acumen and determination.

relationships.Gareth Bryne: General she is bonded to as Warder

22.description: Former Keeper of the Chronicles, now Egwene's Keeper among the rebel Aes Sedai. Stilled and Healed, changed in personality but still loyal.
One of the Great Captains, formerly Captain-General of Andor. Now leads the rebel army and is bonded as Warder to Siuan Sanche.
Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah and Sitter in the rebel Hall. A powerful and ambitious woman who often opposes Egwene's authority.
Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah and Sitter in the rebel Hall. Ambitious and politically savvy, often challenges Egwene's decisions.
Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah and former Mistress of Novices. Now serves among the rebel Aes Sedai, maintaining her role as teacher and guide.
22.role: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah

relationships.Egwene al'Vere: Former teacher, now serves her cause

8.description: A Blue Ajah Aes Sedai supporting the rebel cause and working to restore proper leadership to the Tower.

masema-dagar.name: Masema Dagar
aliases: The Prophet of the Lord Dragon

8.description: Former Shienaran soldier who has become a fanatical prophet, preaching worship of the chosen one. His followers cause chaos across the land.
8.role: The Prophet of the Lord Dragon

relationships.Perrin Aybara: Sent to bring him to Rand

loial.name: Loial
aliases: Loial son of Arent son of Halan

8.description: Ogier from Stedding Shangtai, friend to Rand and his companions. Accompanies Perrin on his mission while continuing to write his book about their adventures.
Former Tinker who abandoned the Way of the Leaf to follow Perrin and learn the sword. Devoted to Perrin but struggles with his violent new path.

26.description: Queen of Ghealdan, struggling to maintain control of her kingdom in the face of the Prophet's influence and various threats to her rule.

relationships.Masema Dagar: Threatened by his presence in her kingdom

31.description: High-ranking Seanchan noble who leads the Return forces. Commands sul'dam and damane while pursuing the Seanchan goal of reclaiming their ancient lands.
Former Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah, now a Black Ajah member captured by the Seanchan and collared as damane. Struggles with her new reality.
One of the ancient enemy, disguised as a Seanchan Truthspeaker. Manipulates the Seanchan forces while pursuing her own agenda.

1.description: High Lady of House Saighan in Cairhien, ambitious and scheming. One of the nobles vying for power in the wake of political upheaval.
Cairhienin lord playing the Game of Houses. Schemes for position and power while navigating the dangerous politics of Rand's rule.

2.description: Cairhienin lord who serves Rand loyally. One of the few nobles Rand trusts to help govern Cairhien effectively.

26.description: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah who serves as advisor to Queen Alliandre of Ghealdan. Skilled in negotiations and political matters.

35.description: Former soldier turned Asha'man with exceptional Healing abilities. One of Rand's most trusted channelers despite his humble origins.
Young Asha'man from Arafel, one of Rand's dedicated followers. Shows promise as both warrior and channeler.
Young Asha'man, one of Rand's dedicated followers. Still learning to control his abilities while serving faithfully.

32.description: Twisted creature carrying both Shadar Logoth's evil and the Dark One's touch. Hunts Rand with obsessive hatred.

1.description: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel, ambitious and power-hungry. Leads her sept in schemes against other Aiel and the wetlanders.
Shaido Wise One, harsh and unforgiving. Works with Sevanna while maintaining her own authority and cruel nature.
Former Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah and Black Ajah member, now captured by the Shaido. Suffers under their harsh treatment.
Clan Chief of the Goshien Aiel, one of Rand's supporters. A strong leader who follows Car'a'carn despite the challenges.
Wise One of the Jhirad Goshien, married to Bael. Skilled in dreamwalking and the ways of the Wise Ones.
Clan Chief of the Taardad Aiel, one of Rand's most trusted supporters. Wise and experienced leader.
Wise One of the Nine Valleys sept, one of Rhuarc's wives. Powerful dreamwalker and teacher to Aviendha.
Ancient Wise One of the Haido Shaarad, cannot channel but is skilled in other Wise One arts. Teacher and guide to younger Wise Ones.

9.description: Young Tairen lord who follows Mat. Enthusiastic warrior who enjoys adventure and battle, loyal to Mat's leadership.
Cairhienin lord and one of Mat's most trusted lieutenants in the Band of the Red Hand. Dry-witted and utterly loyal.

11.description: Officer in the Band of the Red Hand, one of Mat's reliable subordinates. Experienced soldier who helps train and lead the men.
11.role: Band of the Red Hand officer

9.description: Former poacher and smuggler, now scout for the Band of the Red Hand. Excellent tracker and horseman despite his appearance.
Soldier in the Band of the Red Hand, one of Mat's reliable men. Experienced fighter and loyal to the Band's cause.
9.role: Band of the Red Hand soldier

15.description: Whitecloak Inquisitor secretly serving as a Darkfriend. Operating in Ebou Dar while managing conflicting loyalties and orders.

26.description: Former Queen of Andor, now in exile using a false name. Travels with companions while hiding her true identity.
Former Queen's Guard who follows and protects Morgase in exile. Devoted to her beyond mere duty.
Companion to Morgase in exile, formerly a lady of Andoran court. Now shares the hardships of life on the road.

1.description: Perrin's wife and daughter of Davram Bashere. Though not present, her influence on Perrin's actions and decisions remains strong.

26.description: Asha'man accompanying Perrin's group, skilled in the One Power. Provides channeling support for their mission.
Asha'man with Perrin's group, experienced soldier before learning to channel. Reliable and skilled in both warfare and the Power.
First of Mayene, accompanying Perrin on his mission. Skilled ruler and diplomat seeking to protect her small nation's interests.
Captain of Berelain's Winged Guards, a skilled soldier with an eyepatch. Loyal to Mayene and efficient in his duties.
Former secretary to Pedron Niall, now serving Perrin. Excellent at gathering information and managing administrative matters.

13.description: Mistress of the Ships to the Atha'an Miere, highest authority among the Sea Folk. Negotiates with Aes Sedai regarding the Bowl of the Winds.
Sea Folk Windfinder and negotiator, skilled in the One Power. Represents her people's interests in dealings with the Aes Sedai.

relationships.Nesta din Reas: Serves under as Mistress of Ships

9.description: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah, part of the embassy from the White Tower. Skilled negotiator caught up in the search for the Bowl.
9.role: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah

9.description: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah, elderly scholar and sister to Vandene. Part of the group searching for the Bowl of the Winds.
9.role: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah

9.description: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah, sister to Adeleas. Part of the group working to find and use the Bowl of the Winds.
9.role: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah

9.description: Warder to Vandene Namelle, elderly but still capable. Devoted to his Aes Sedai and protective of the group's mission.

relationships.Adeleas Namelle: Protects as sister to his Aes Sedai

9.description: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah, part of the embassy from the White Tower. Involved in the search for the Bowl of the Winds.
9.role: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah

9.description: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah, part of the group from the White Tower. Scholar and researcher helping with their mission.
9.role: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah

9.description: Aes Sedai captured by the group, revealed to be Black Ajah. Held prisoner while they try to extract information from her.

15.description: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah, revealed to be Black Ajah. Working in Ebou Dar on dark missions while evading capture.
Former Aes Sedai, now revealed as Black Ajah. Operating in Ebou Dar as part of dark schemes.

1.description: One of the ancient enemy, recently appeared with a new identity. Serves under Moridin's authority while pursuing her own goals.

23.description: One of the ancient enemy in a new body, working among the rebel Aes Sedai as Halima. Manipulates events while appearing to help.

22.description: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah and Sitter in the rebel Hall. Appears to support Egwene but has hidden loyalties.
Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah among the rebels, skilled in various weaves. Works to support the rebel cause.
22.role: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah

22.description: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah among the rebels, skilled Healer. Works to support their cause while practicing her Ajah's goals.
22.role: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah

8.description: A Brown Ajah Aes Sedai contributing her knowledge and research skills to the rebel effort.

22.description: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah among the rebels. Known for having multiple Warders and her skills in battle.
22.role: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah

23.description: Secretary to Delana Mosalaine, provides massages to Egwene for her headaches. Appears helpful but has hidden motives.

32.description: Ruler of Illian, actually the ancient enemy Sammael in disguise. Commands the Illian forces while preparing for confrontation.
High-ranking lord of Illian, serves under Lord Brend. Skilled military commander and loyal to his nation.

1.description: One of the ancient enemy, plotting and scheming from the shadows. Maintains his own agenda while serving the Shadow's cause.
One of the ancient enemy, works to corrupt and destroy from within. Maintains her own schemes while serving the greater darkness.
One of the ancient enemy, now dead. His absence is felt as the remaining ancient enemy continue their schemes without him.

14.description: A high-ranking Seanchan noble overseeing their expansion into mainland territories.

35.description: Continues coordinating the Seanchan consolidation of conquered territories with typical Seanchan efficiency.

20.description: A mysterious high-ranking Seanchan figure mentioned in prophecies and planning.

14.description: A Seanchan ship captain operating in the areas of Seanchan expansion.
A ship captain involved in the complex politics and conflicts of the coastal regions.

28.description: An innkeeper in Ebou Dar with connections to various groups and knowledge of the city's intricate social structure.

35.description: Provides assistance and information to various parties while maintaining her position in Ebou Dar society.

28.description: A member of the Anan family in Ebou Dar, connected to the inn and local community.

8.description: A young woman with a talent for Foretelling, involved with the rebel Aes Sedai camp.

29.description: Continues developing her abilities while navigating the complex politics of the Aes Sedai rebellion.

8.description: A young woman training with the rebel Aes Sedai, working to develop her channeling abilities.
A former Captain-General of Andor now serving as military leader for the rebel Aes Sedai.

29.description: Continues organizing the rebel army while working closely with Egwene and the rebel leadership.

8.description: The former Amyrlin Seat, now stilled and working with the rebel Aes Sedai to regain the Tower.

29.description: Provides counsel and experience to the rebel cause while adapting to her changed circumstances.

8.description: Former Keeper of the Chronicles, now stilled and working alongside Siuan with the rebel Aes Sedai.
A Green Ajah Aes Sedai among the rebels, known for her ability with Warders.

15.description: A Yellow Ajah Aes Sedai working with the rebel faction to heal the division in the Tower.

8.description: A White Ajah Aes Sedai applying logical analysis to the rebel strategies and plans.

15.description: A Gray Ajah Aes Sedai working on negotiations and diplomatic solutions for the Tower's reunification.
An Aes Sedai supporting the rebel faction in their efforts to reclaim proper Tower leadership.

28.description: A noble or merchant in Ebou Dar involved in the city's complex social and political networks.
The Queen of Altara ruling from Ebou Dar, navigating the complex politics of her nation and city.

35.description: Continues managing her kingdom while dealing with various factions and external pressures.

28.description: A Gray Ajah Aes Sedai working in Ebou Dar on matters related to Aes Sedai interests.
A Brown Ajah Aes Sedai researching in Ebou Dar, contributing her scholarly expertise to various efforts.
A Green Ajah Aes Sedai, sister to Adeleas, working alongside her in Ebou Dar.

31.description: A member of the Kin in Ebou Dar, part of the organization that helps women who can channel.
A senior member of the Kin in Ebou Dar, helping to organize their activities and provide guidance.

22.description: A former Amyrlin Seat whose decisions and actions continue to influence current events.

15.description: A former Keeper known for her Foretelling ability, whose prophecies continue to guide events.

18.description: A legendary Aes Sedai known for her strength, age, and unique approach to dealing with difficult situations.

35.description: Continues her work with her distinctive methods, maintaining her reputation as one of the most formidable Aes Sedai.

34.description: A Sea Folk Wavemistress involved in negotiations and Sea Folk politics.
A Sea Folk woman working with the Wavemistresses in their maritime and political affairs.
A Sea Folk Windfinder contributing her weather-working abilities to Sea Folk operations.
A high-ranking Sea Folk leader involved in their negotiations and maritime governance.
A Sea Folk Windfinder working with the weather and supporting Sea Folk interests in various negotiations.
A Sea Folk Sailmistress commanding a ship and representing Sea Folk interests in coastal affairs.
A Sea Folk woman serving aboard the ships and contributing to Sea Folk maritime activities.

18.description: An Aiel Wise One providing counsel and maintaining Aiel traditions during these changing times.
An Aiel Wise One working with the others to guide the Aiel through the prophecies and changes.
An Aiel Wise One contributing to the leadership and decision-making of the Aiel clans.
An Aiel Wise One helping to maintain clan unity and traditional wisdom during turbulent times.

6.description: An Aiel warrior serving among Rand's personal guard, demonstrating Aiel honor and fighting skills.
An Aiel Maiden of the Spear protecting Rand while maintaining her warrior traditions and duties.
An Aiel Maiden of the Spear serving as part of Rand's guard while upholding Maiden customs.

31.description: A member of the Kin in Ebou Dar, working to help women who can channel while avoiding Aes Sedai notice.
Another member of the Kin in Ebou Dar, contributing to their network of aid and support for channelers.
A skilled member of the Kin in Ebou Dar, known for her healing abilities and organizational skills.
A member of the Kin working in Ebou Dar to maintain their hidden network and provide assistance.
A member of the Kin in Ebou Dar, helping to coordinate their activities and maintain secrecy.
A member of the Kin contributing to their mission of helping women with the ability to channel.
A member of the Kin in Ebou Dar working to support their network while avoiding detection.
A leading member of the Kin in Ebou Dar, helping to organize and protect their community of women who can channel.
A member of the Kin working with the others to provide aid and maintain their hidden organization.

28.description: An Aes Sedai working in Ebou Dar on the mission to find the Bowl of the Winds and help with the weather.

35.description: Continues working with the Kin and Sea Folk to locate and use the ter'angreal needed to fix the weather patterns.

28.description: An Aes Sedai and Daughter-Heir of Andor working in Ebou Dar to find the Bowl of the Winds.

35.description: Continues the crucial mission while dealing with the complex politics and dangers of working with various groups.

28.description: A legendary archer now serving as Elayne's Warder, providing protection and her extensive experience.

35.description: Continues her protective duties while adapting her legendary skills to the current dangerous circumstances.

28.description: A ta'veren with the foxhead medallion in Ebou Dar, dealing with various complications while trying to help his friends.

35.description: Continues navigating the complex political and social situation in Ebou Dar while supporting the mission.

28.description: A skilled gleeman and former court bard providing intelligence and support to the mission in Ebou Dar.

35.description: Continues using his extensive knowledge and contacts to aid the group's efforts in the dangerous city.

recaps.prologue: Elaida receives disturbing reports while consolidating her power as Amyrlin. The ancient enemy gather to discuss their plans and receive new orders from the Dark One through Shaidar Haran.
recaps.1: Rand deals with political intrigue in Cairhien while Min has viewings about the future. The rebel Aes Sedai continue their preparations while Sevanna plots with the Shaido.
recaps.2: Rand attempts to bring order to Cairhien while dealing with scheming nobles. Perrin prepares for his mission to find the Prophet Masema in Ghealdan.
recaps.3: Rand visits the Black Tower and sees Mazrim Taim training the Asha'man. Political tensions rise in Cairhien as various factions vie for position.
recaps.4: Rand continues managing the complex politics of Cairhien while preparing for his next moves. The Asha'man train and grow in number under Taim's leadership.
recaps.5: Rand makes plans to deal with Sammael in Illian while trying to keep various factions in line. Tensions build as schemes develop on multiple fronts.
recaps.6: Rand prepares for action while dealing with the ongoing political situation. Various forces position themselves for the conflicts to come.
recaps.7: Rand's plans begin to move forward as he prepares to take action. Aviendha and the Wise Ones continue their own preparations and discussions.
recaps.8: Perrin sets out with his group to find Masema, accompanied by Loial and Aram. They encounter various challenges and political complications along the way.
recaps.9: Mat finds himself increasingly involved with Queen Tylin in Ebou Dar while helping search for the Bowl of the Winds. The group faces various complications in their mission.
recaps.10: The search for the Bowl continues in Ebou Dar with Mat, Nynaeve, and Elayne encountering both help and obstacles. Political intrigue complicates their efforts.
recaps.11: Mat deals with his complicated relationship with Queen Tylin while the search for the Bowl becomes more urgent. The Band of the Red Hand maintains readiness.
recaps.12: The group in Ebou Dar makes progress in their search while navigating the complex political and social situation in Altara. New allies and enemies emerge.
recaps.13: Negotiations with the Sea Folk regarding the Bowl of the Winds become complex. The group must balance various competing interests and demands.
recaps.14: The Kin are discovered and their role in the search becomes clear. Reanne and other members are reluctantly drawn into the larger conflict.
recaps.15: The search for the Bowl intensifies as various factions converge on Ebou Dar. Black Ajah members are discovered and captured, complicating the situation.
recaps.16: Progress is made toward finding the Bowl of the Winds. The various groups must work together despite their differences and conflicting goals.
recaps.17: The location of the Bowl is finally discovered. Preparations begin for what may be a dangerous mission to retrieve this powerful ter'angreal.
recaps.18: Cadsuane Melaidhrin, a legendary Aes Sedai, arrives to meet Rand. Her presence and reputation immediately change the dynamic around the chosen one.
recaps.19: Cadsuane establishes her authority and begins her own agenda regarding Rand. Her interactions with his followers reveal her formidable nature and experience.
recaps.20: Rand deals with Cadsuane's presence and demands while managing his other responsibilities. The legendary Aes Sedai proves to be unlike anyone he has encountered.
recaps.21: Political and personal tensions continue to build around Rand as various factions and individuals pursue their own goals and agendas.
recaps.22: Egwene works to consolidate her authority as Amyrlin among the rebel Aes Sedai. She faces opposition from various Sitters and must navigate complex politics.
recaps.23: The rebel Aes Sedai continue their preparations while internal politics create challenges for Egwene's leadership. Halima provides assistance with Egwene's headaches.
recaps.24: Egwene's authority is tested as she works to unite the rebel Aes Sedai. Various factions within the rebels pursue their own agendas.
recaps.25: The rebel Aes Sedai face continued challenges in their preparations. Egwene must balance various competing interests while maintaining her position.
recaps.26: Perrin's group encounters Queen Alliandre and learns about the situation with Masema. The Prophet's influence has created chaos and division.
recaps.27: Perrin meets with Masema and attempts to bring him to Rand. The Prophet's fanatical nature and the situation in Ghealdan prove more complex than expected.
recaps.28: Mat continues to deal with his situation in Ebou Dar while the search for the Bowl reaches critical stages. Various factions prepare for action.
recaps.29: The Bowl of the Winds is finally located and the group prepares for the dangerous mission to retrieve it from its hiding place.
recaps.30: The Bowl of the Winds is successfully retrieved, but using it proves to be complex and dangerous. The various groups must work together despite their differences.
recaps.31: The Weather working begins with the Bowl of the Winds. The massive channeling draws attention from both allies and enemies across the region.
recaps.32: Rand begins his assault on Illian, moving against Sammael. The long-awaited confrontation between the chosen one and the ancient enemy approaches.
recaps.33: The battle for Illian intensifies as Rand's forces engage Sammael's defenses. Both sides deploy their most powerful weapons and strategies.
recaps.34: Rand and Sammael face each other in direct confrontation. The battle between chosen one and ancient enemy reaches its climactic conclusion.
recaps.35: In the aftermath of the confrontation with Sammael, Rand deals with his injuries and the consequences of the battle. New challenges emerge.
recaps.36: Rand recovers from his encounter while dealing with the political aftermath in Illian. His injury from Padan Fain creates ongoing complications.
recaps.37: The situation in Illian stabilizes as Rand establishes his authority. However, his wound continues to cause problems and concern among his followers.
recaps.38: Mat and his companions prepare to leave Ebou Dar after the Bowl working. The successful mission has had far-reaching consequences.
recaps.39: The group escapes from Ebou Dar as Seanchan forces approach the city. The Return has begun and changes everything about the political situation.
recaps.40: The Seanchan arrival in Ebou Dar marks a major turning point. Various factions must adapt to this new and dangerous threat from across the sea.
recaps.41: The weather begins to change as a result of the Bowl's working. The various storylines reach resolution as characters deal with the consequences of their actions.
